content: A railway-building board game is a type of tabletop game where players take on the role of railroad entrepreneurs or investors and compete to build the most successful and profitable railway network. The players typically take turns laying railway tracks, connecting cities or destinations, and acquiring railroad company stocks or assets. The goal is usually to accumulate the most wealth or points by strategically managing resources, investing in infrastructure, and maximizing the efficiency of their railway routes. Some popular examples of railway-building board games include Ticket to Ride, Age of Steam, and Railroad Tycoon.
